metadata.subject: Science
metadata.notes: KS2 Working Scientifically is split into Lower KS2 (Years 3-4) and Upper KS2 (Years 5-6) bands in the NC, but is treated here as a single KS2 tier for graph purposes, drawing primarily on the Upper KS2 statements as the end-of-KS expectation. Lower KS2 statements are referenced in descriptions where they represent a distinct earlier step. KS3 WS is drawn from the statutory programme of study for KS3 Science (DFE-00185-2013).

skills.description: Posing simple questions about observations and recognising that different types of question require different approaches to find an answer, including tests, observations over time, and looking in books.
skills.source_reference: National Curriculum 2014, DFE-00182-2013 — Science KS1: Working Scientifically
skills.nc_verbatim: asking simple questions and recognising that they can be answered in different ways

skills.description: Using the senses and simple equipment such as magnifying glasses to make careful first-hand observations of objects, organisms and phenomena.
skills.source_reference: National Curriculum 2014, DFE-00182-2013 — Science KS1: Working Scientifically
skills.nc_verbatim: observing closely, using simple equipment

skills.description: Carrying out simple practical investigations to explore questions, with early awareness that some things should be kept the same while one thing is changed.
skills.source_reference: National Curriculum 2014, DFE-00182-2013 — Science KS1: Working Scientifically
skills.nc_verbatim: performing simple tests

skills.description: Sorting and grouping objects, organisms or materials according to their observable characteristics, recognising that things can be classified in more than one way depending on which features are selected.
skills.source_reference: National Curriculum 2014, DFE-00182-2013 — Science KS1: Working Scientifically
skills.nc_verbatim: identifying and classifying

skills.description: Making connections between what has been observed and possible answers to questions, explaining reasoning in accessible language and recognising when observations support or challenge initial ideas.
skills.source_reference: National Curriculum 2014, DFE-00182-2013 — Science KS1: Working Scientifically
skills.nc_verbatim: using their observations and ideas to suggest answers to questions

skills.description: Collecting information from observations or tests and presenting it in simple forms including drawings, labelled diagrams, tables and pictograms to support answering a scientific question.
skills.source_reference: National Curriculum 2014, DFE-00182-2013 — Science KS1: Working Scientifically
skills.nc_verbatim: gathering and recording data to help in answering questions

skills.skill_name: Asking relevant questions and selecting enquiry types
skills.description: Formulating focused scientific questions and selecting the most appropriate enquiry method to answer them, choosing between observing over time, pattern seeking, classifying, comparative tests, fair tests, or secondary research as the situation demands.
skills.source_reference: National Curriculum 2014, DFE-00182-2013 — Science KS2: Working Scientifically
skills.nc_verbatim: asking relevant questions and using different types of scientific enquiries to answer them

skills.description: Conducting careful, methodical observations and taking accurate measurements using standard units and a range of scientific equipment, including thermometers and data loggers, with Upper KS2 pupils also taking repeat readings to improve reliability.
skills.source_reference: National Curriculum 2014, DFE-00182-2013 — Science KS2: Working Scientifically
skills.nc_verbatim: taking measurements, using a range of scientific equipment, with increasing accuracy and precision, taking repeat readings when appropriate

skills.description: Planning different types of scientific enquiry to answer questions, with Upper KS2 pupils recognising and controlling variables — identifying independent, dependent and control variables — to ensure a fair and valid investigation.
skills.source_reference: National Curriculum 2014, DFE-00182-2013 — Science KS2: Working Scientifically
skills.nc_verbatim: planning different types of scientific enquiries to answer questions, including recognising and controlling variables where necessary

skills.description: Sorting objects and organisms into groups using classification keys and identifying similarities, differences and changes related to scientific ideas and processes across collected data.
skills.source_reference: National Curriculum 2014, DFE-00182-2013 — Science KS2: Working Scientifically
skills.nc_verbatim: identifying differences, similarities or changes related to simple scientific ideas and processes

skills.description: Presenting collected data and results in an appropriate range of formats — including scientific diagrams, labelled drawings, classification keys, tables, bar charts, line graphs and scatter graphs — selecting the format suited to the type of data.
skills.source_reference: National Curriculum 2014, DFE-00182-2013 — Science KS2: Working Scientifically
skills.nc_verbatim: recording data and results of increasing complexity using scientific diagrams and labels, classification keys, tables, scatter graphs, bar and line graphs

skills.description: Using collected data to draw conclusions, identify causal relationships, make and test predictions, and assess the degree of trust that can be placed in results, recognising when evidence supports or refutes a scientific idea.
skills.source_reference: National Curriculum 2014, DFE-00182-2013 — Science KS2: Working Scientifically
skills.nc_verbatim: reporting and presenting findings from enquiries, including conclusions, causal relationships and explanations of and degree of trust in results, in oral and written forms such as displays and other presentations

skills.description: Presenting the outcomes of scientific enquiry in oral and written forms — including explanations, displays and presentations — using appropriate scientific language and representations to convey methods, results and conclusions clearly to others.
skills.source_reference: National Curriculum 2014, DFE-00182-2013 — Science KS2: Working Scientifically
skills.nc_verbatim: reporting on findings from enquiries, including oral and written explanations, displays or presentations of results and conclusions

skills.skill_name: Using evidence to support or refute ideas
skills.description: Critically examining scientific evidence — including evidence generated by pupils themselves and from secondary sources — to assess whether it supports or challenges a given scientific claim or argument.
skills.source_reference: National Curriculum 2014, DFE-00182-2013 — Science KS2: Working Scientifically
skills.nc_verbatim: identifying scientific evidence that has been used to support or refute ideas or arguments

skills.description: Formulating testable questions and hypotheses grounded in prior knowledge and observation of the real world, and developing a coherent line of enquiry that connects question, prediction, method, data and conclusion.
skills.source_reference: National Curriculum 2014, DFE-00185-2013 — Science KS3: Working Scientifically
skills.nc_verbatim: ask questions and develop a line of enquiry based on observations of the real world, alongside prior knowledge and experience

skills.skill_name: Scientific attitudes: accuracy, precision and reproducibility
skills.description: Consistently applying objectivity and commitment to accuracy, precision, repeatability and reproducibility in scientific work, understanding why these qualities are essential to the credibility and usefulness of scientific findings.
skills.source_reference: National Curriculum 2014, DFE-00185-2013 — Science KS3: Working Scientifically
skills.nc_verbatim: pay attention to objectivity and concern for accuracy, precision, repeatability and reproducibility

skills.description: Selecting, planning and carrying out the most appropriate enquiry type to test a prediction, explicitly identifying and managing independent, dependent and control variables to produce valid experimental results.
skills.source_reference: National Curriculum 2014, DFE-00185-2013 — Science KS3: Working Scientifically
skills.nc_verbatim: select, plan and carry out the most appropriate types of scientific enquiries to test predictions, including identifying independent, dependent and control variables, where appropriate

skills.skill_name: Making and recording observations with evaluation of method
skills.description: Conducting observations and measurements using a range of apparatus and methods appropriate to the investigation, and critically evaluating the reliability of those methods with reasoned suggestions for improvement.
skills.source_reference: National Curriculum 2014, DFE-00185-2013 — Science KS3: Working Scientifically
skills.nc_verbatim: make and record observations and measurements using a range of methods for different investigations; and evaluate the reliability of methods and suggest possible improvements

skills.skill_name: Presenting data using tables and graphs
skills.description: Selecting appropriate tabular and graphical formats to present data clearly and accurately, applying mathematical concepts including scales, units, and graphical conventions to communicate quantitative information effectively.
skills.source_reference: National Curriculum 2014, DFE-00185-2013 — Science KS3: Working Scientifically
skills.nc_verbatim: present observations and data using appropriate methods, including tables and graphs

skills.description: Analysing observations and quantitative data to identify trends, correlations and patterns, and using these findings to draw evidence-based conclusions that go beyond a simple restatement of the results.
skills.source_reference: National Curriculum 2014, DFE-00185-2013 — Science KS3: Working Scientifically
skills.nc_verbatim: interpret observations and data, including identifying patterns and using observations, measurements and data to draw conclusions

skills.skill_name: Presenting reasoned explanations in relation to hypotheses
skills.description: Constructing written and oral explanations that account for data in relation to the original prediction and hypothesis, distinguishing clearly between what the data shows and what can be concluded from it.
skills.source_reference: National Curriculum 2014, DFE-00185-2013 — Science KS3: Working Scientifically
skills.nc_verbatim: present reasoned explanations, including explaining data in relation to predictions and hypotheses

skills.description: Producing clear written and oral reports of scientific enquiries that distinguish data from interpretation and that use correct scientific terminology, SI units and IUPAC nomenclature to communicate with precision and clarity.
skills.source_reference: National Curriculum 2014, DFE-00185-2013 — Science KS3: Working Scientifically
skills.nc_verbatim: understand and use SI units and IUPAC (International Union of Pure and Applied Chemistry) chemical nomenclature unless inappropriate

skills.skill_name: Evaluating evidence and understanding scientific knowledge development
skills.description: Critically evaluating data for random and systematic error, and understanding how scientific methods and theories evolve as new evidence emerges — including the roles of publication, peer review and replication in establishing trustworthy scientific knowledge.
skills.source_reference: National Curriculum 2014, DFE-00185-2013 — Science KS3: Working Scientifically
skills.nc_verbatim: evaluate data, showing awareness of potential sources of random and systematic error

skills.description: Generating testable predictions prior to investigation by applying existing scientific understanding, and subsequently assessing how well experimental outcomes match those predictions to refine understanding.
skills.source_reference: National Curriculum 2014, DFE-00185-2013 — Science KS3: Working Scientifically
skills.nc_verbatim: make predictions using scientific knowledge and understanding

skills.description: Applying mathematical and basic statistical techniques — including calculating means, ranges, and using equations — to process, analyse and interpret quantitative scientific data, including the use of scatter graphs and data analysis tools.
skills.source_reference: National Curriculum 2014, DFE-00185-2013 — Science KS3: Working Scientifically
skills.nc_verbatim: undertake basic data analysis including simple statistical techniques

skills.description: Identifying and evaluating hazards associated with planned scientific procedures and taking appropriate precautions to minimise risk, including safe handling of equipment, chemicals and biological material during laboratory and fieldwork.
skills.source_reference: National Curriculum 2014, DFE-00185-2013 — Science KS3: Working Scientifically
skills.nc_verbatim: evaluate risks
